Hey <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/118088719859349999400" oid="118088719859349999400">Mark Tygart</a></span>, I recently got an read your Dungeon Starters book and really am loving it.  You mention that one thing I should do as a GM is fill out my worksheet.  Can you tell me what worksheet you are referring to?
<div id='comment z13ezjup0ruojpewj04cgnz5nweosb0op04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/118088719859349999400_photo.jpg'> Mark Tygart</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-11-13 04:49:23 (edited: 2017-11-13 04:49:40)</cite></p>
        <p>That is something I picked up from Marshall Miller&#39;s  standard format text and may still  be downloadable from the Dungeon World site: <br /><br /><a href="https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B8_Fz4m5hcoieW1GRVVaNnRfbnc" data-embed="_" data-attachment-render-hint="1" class="ot-anchor">drive.google.com - Dungeon_World_Play_Sheets.pdf</a><br /><br />A worksheet for fronts, I think.</p>
</div>
